blog.name: slytherkins
blog.title: Mrs. King of Hell
blog.description: ***18+ blog. If you're a minor: drink plenty of water, eat some veggies occasionally, make sure you get enough sleep, and please fuck off elsewhere until you're grown.***  Too old for you. Chronically enthused. Aries. Lokean. Storm Witch. Fangirl. Gryffindor. Coffee addict. Socially inept INFP. Mildly obsessive. *is the personification of a glomp* If you mention Severus Snape to me, I -will- weep. Accused of being cute by people in RL with exasperating regularity, usually after RANTING AND RADIATING PURE, UNADULTERATED RAGE. (I don't understand it. WHY DON'T THEY FEAR ME?) Disabled and physically incapable of doing anything but compute all day. I'm not stalking you, I'm just bored. Bernie is my grandpa. Buddy the Elf is my patronus. Crowley is my King.

tags: somebody seriously needs to stop me
summary:
In which Rose Tyler and Anthony Crowley get to know one another.
The pair of them stood outside of her flat, the nearest...
body:
In which Rose Tyler and Anthony Crowley get to know one another.

The pair of them stood outside of her flat, the nearest streetlight flickering as if it was anxious about the nearby demonic presence.

“At the risk of sounding ungrateful, that was - by far - the weirdest, grimmest, most fucked up date I’ve ever been on,” Rose said seriously. “I mean it. And I once went on a date where I saw my own planet completely swallowed by the sun.”

Crowley smiled and she could swear she saw his forked tongue peeking out from between his insanely white teeth. “Why, thank you.”

Rose was quite sure they’d be doomed to stand there in silence forever - because he was clearly relishing her mild discomfort - when a thought occurred to her.

She grinned. “Wanna come up?”

tags: i'm having way too much fun
summary:
"Bloody hell, woman. 'Meet me in hell'? Really?"
"Well, how else am I supposed to get your attention, then?"
"You could try a...
body:
“Bloody hell, woman. ’Meet me in hell’? Really?”

“Well, how else am I supposed to get your attention, then?”

“You could try a phone call, Rose.”

“Christ, Crowley, you’re no fun at all.”

reblog.comment:

“Bloody hell, woman. ’Meet me in hell’? Really?”

“Well, how else am I supposed to get your attention, then?”

“You could try a phone call, Rose.”

“Christ, Crowley, you’re no fun at all.”

blog.name: aziraphalesbian
blog.title: michael! dude!
blog.description: i'm koraliss i'm 18 and i enjoy overthinking gay subtext

summary: aziraphale is a black and white thinker but crowley is not! aziraphale stayed on heaven’s side his whole life but crowley...
body: aziraphale is a black and white thinker but crowley is not! aziraphale stayed on heaven’s side his whole life but crowley “sauntered vaguely downwards” and got to see all the shades of grey along the way! so because he’s been both “good” and “evil,” he better understands not only how arbitrary those categories are but how easily it is to slide, accidentally or not, from good to evil or even from evil to good! aziraphale and crowley, at least at first, have very different ways of looking at humanity because crowley is on the bottom of the world looking up and aziraphale is on the top of the world looking down! but as the book progresses, they meet each other in the middle and see the other viewpoint and that’s love and that’s balance and that’s mutual understanding babey and that’s what it’s all about!!

body:
When Rose Tyler met Anthony Crowley.

“I knew a bloke who looked like you, once. Only he had better hair and was practically a god.”

“Yes, but gods are so dull, aren’t they?”

summary: Monopoly for foolishness
title: Monopoly for foolishness
body:
“Bold choice,” someone said. “Tea in a pub.”

He scrunched his nose slightly.

“My… friend convinced the barman to prepare me a cup,” he explained. “I’m not a particular fan of the taste of beer.”

“Ah,” the man sipped his own pint. “That means this seat is taken then? I meant to ask if I could sit down for a moment,” he changed his stance uncomfortably, taking his weight off his right leg.

Interesting.

“No, he…” he frowned, replacing the cup on the saucer. “He will not be back anytime soon. Wanted to dance, and I…”

“And you are not one for dancing?” the man with the beer finally took the chair opposite. “Cheers.”

He wasn’t sure if there was a protocol for drinking a toast with tea, but the wide grin seemed impossible to ignore.

“Well, I’m more of a ballroom dancer,” he admitted. “I am getting better at this… modern stuff, but I’m not up this particular challenge.”

The whole room was shaking slightly to the rhythm of something-or-other by Queen. Very much not his cup of tea.

“Ah, I see,” a sip of beer and the man smiled, looking at the gyrating and grinding crowd. “I have the moves, but it seems I also have an old soldier’s joints and bones, and they are protesting against such abuse, so I have to sit down once in a while and let them rest. My…” he gestured. “My friend is younger than me, so I left him to the entertainment and decided to recharge.”

Suddenly a tall, gangly man tore himself away from the dancing floor and marched towards them with a purpose.

“Why aren’t you on your position?” he demanded of his friend, who smiled at him indulgently.

Ah, mortals. How much time they waste by thinking what they want to say and how hard it is for them to finally say it.

“I needed a beer, Shezza,” the man rolled eyes at his taller companion. “Not everyone can live, like you, on water, milk and jammy biscuits every three days. Give me a minute, I will finish this and we can go.”

“But James! Someone could be getting attacked right now…! I have to follow up the lead and it all started here, during dancing. And when you are not there, how am I supposed to Work?”

Ah. A Work with capital W. Interesting.

“I know, I know. But I still need my beer and a moment to catch my breath. Give me that I will join you and we’ll find out who is messing with the memories and pocketbooks of these young idiots.”
Shezza grimaced with distaste, but flounced away and rejoined the dancers, throwing one last glare at his friend over his shoulder.

Ah. Mortals. Mortal love. Wonder if they know how much they are missing.

The blonde in front of him smiled, shaking his head.

“I don’t know why I keep following this madman,” he said, barely audible over the new song. “But he would be lost without me and I’d be lost without him,” he shrugged and slowly finished his beer. “Thank you for the company. I have to check if he is not getting into any trouble.”

“Sure,” he sipped his tea. “Have a nice evening, James.”

They were both very bad at lying, both to each other and to themselves. “James” was hopelessly in love with his “madman” and “Shezza” seemed unable to function without his supportive friend. And the way they looked at each other…!

Someone in the crowd moved and for a moment he thought it was “Shezza” trying to find his friend, but then the eyes glinted with yellow and the grin widened into a proper smile at the sight of him. He felt an answering smile tugging at his lips. It was incredible, how long they managed to stay under the radar, becoming much more than they were supposed to be - closer than brothers, more than friends, they were… More.

He saw “James” and “Shezza” through the crowd and watched as they moved fluidly to the music, completely oblivious to the crowd around them..

“How about it, angel?” Crowley’s voice rasped in his ear and for a moment he felt stopped-suspended-held and then the demon was pulling him out of his chair. “You’re done with your tea then? Perfect. Come on. I must have you dance.”

“It’s unfair to use quotes from classical romances against me,” he grumbled. “Also, we should consider a change of venue, if you want to keep toying with these idiots who insulted us the last time.”

Because whatever else they needed in their post-not-apocalyptic life on Earth, they definitely did not need the London’s one and only Consulting Detective and his faithful blogger on their tail.

Crowley shrugged and smiled at him in a rather fond fashion.

Just behind him, on the left, John Watson was saying something sternly to Sherlock Holmes.

Who shrugged and smiled at him in a rather fond fashion.

Aziraphale blinked.

“What?” Crowley raised one eyebrow in an inquiry.

“Mortals aren’t the ones with a monopoly for being fools.”

@the-persian-slipper @anonymous-user987654321 @bookgirlwithlove @kestrelwing64 @technicallywiseoncns @7-percent @a-study-in-deduction-221b @battledress @a-candle-for-sherlock @underestimatemethatwillbefun @theconsultinglinguist @melsesowieso
body_abstract:
“Bold choice,” someone said. “Tea in a pub.”

He scrunched his nose slightly.

“My… friend convinced the barman to prepare me a cup,” he explained. “I’m not a particular fan of the taste of beer.”

“Ah,” the man sipped his own pint. “That means this seat is taken then? I meant to ask if I could sit down for a moment,” he changed his stance uncomfortably, taking his weight off his right leg.

reblog.comment:
“Bold choice,” someone said. “Tea in a pub.”

He scrunched his nose slightly.

“My… friend convinced the barman to prepare me a cup,” he explained. “I’m not a particular fan of the taste of beer.”

“Ah,” the man sipped his own pint. “That means this seat is taken then? I meant to ask if I could sit down for a moment,” he changed his stance uncomfortably, taking his weight off his right leg.

[[MORE]]

Interesting.

“No, he…” he frowned, replacing the cup on the saucer. “He will not be back anytime soon. Wanted to dance, and I…”

“And you are not one for dancing?” the man with the beer finally took the chair opposite. “Cheers.”

He wasn’t sure if there was a protocol for drinking a toast with tea, but the wide grin seemed impossible to ignore.

“Well, I’m more of a ballroom dancer,” he admitted. “I am getting better at this… modern stuff, but I’m not up this particular challenge.”

The whole room was shaking slightly to the rhythm of something-or-other by Queen. Very much not his cup of tea.

“Ah, I see,” a sip of beer and the man smiled, looking at the gyrating and grinding crowd. “I have the moves, but it seems I also have an old soldier’s joints and bones, and they are protesting against such abuse, so I have to sit down once in a while and let them rest. My…” he gestured. “My friend is younger than me, so I left him to the entertainment and decided to recharge.”

Suddenly a tall, gangly man tore himself away from the dancing floor and marched towards them with a purpose.

“Why aren’t you on your position?” he demanded of his friend, who smiled at him indulgently.

Ah, mortals. How much time they waste by thinking what they want to say and how hard it is for them to finally say it.

“I needed a beer, Shezza,” the man rolled eyes at his taller companion. “Not everyone can live, like you, on water, milk and jammy biscuits every three days. Give me a minute, I will finish this and we can go.”

“But James! Someone could be getting attacked right now…! I have to follow up the lead and it all started here, during dancing. And when you are not there, how am I supposed to Work?”

Ah. A Work with capital W. Interesting.

“I know, I know. But I still need my beer and a moment to catch my breath. Give me that I will join you and we’ll find out who is messing with the memories and pocketbooks of these young idiots.”
Shezza grimaced with distaste, but flounced away and rejoined the dancers, throwing one last glare at his friend over his shoulder.

Ah. Mortals. Mortal love. Wonder if they know how much they are missing.

The blonde in front of him smiled, shaking his head.

“I don’t know why I keep following this madman,” he said, barely audible over the new song. “But he would be lost without me and I’d be lost without him,” he shrugged and slowly finished his beer. “Thank you for the company. I have to check if he is not getting into any trouble.”

“Sure,” he sipped his tea. “Have a nice evening, James.”

They were both very bad at lying, both to each other and to themselves. “James” was hopelessly in love with his “madman” and “Shezza” seemed unable to function without his supportive friend. And the way they looked at each other…!

Someone in the crowd moved and for a moment he thought it was “Shezza” trying to find his friend, but then the eyes glinted with yellow and the grin widened into a proper smile at the sight of him. He felt an answering smile tugging at his lips. It was incredible, how long they managed to stay under the radar, becoming much more than they were supposed to be - closer than brothers, more than friends, they were… More.

He saw “James” and “Shezza” through the crowd and watched as they moved fluidly to the music, completely oblivious to the crowd around them..

“How about it, angel?” Crowley’s voice rasped in his ear and for a moment he felt stopped-suspended-held and then the demon was pulling him out of his chair. “You’re done with your tea then? Perfect. Come on. I must have you dance.”

“It’s unfair to use quotes from classical romances against me,” he grumbled. “Also, we should consider a change of venue, if you want to keep toying with these idiots who insulted us the last time.”

Because whatever else they needed in their post-not-apocalyptic life on Earth, they definitely did not need the London’s one and only Consulting Detective and his faithful blogger on their tail.

Crowley shrugged and smiled at him in a rather fond fashion.

Just behind him, on the left, John Watson was saying something sternly to Sherlock Holmes.

Who shrugged and smiled at him in a rather fond fashion.

Aziraphale blinked.

“What?” Crowley raised one eyebrow in an inquiry.

“Mortals aren’t the ones with a monopoly for being fools.”

@the-persian-slipper @anonymous-user987654321 @bookgirlwithlove @kestrelwing64 @technicallywiseoncns @7-percent @a-study-in-deduction-221b @battledress @a-candle-for-sherlock @underestimatemethatwillbefun @theconsultinglinguist @melsesowieso

blog.name: siahposh
blog.title: The Dark Side
blog.description: Sima Siahposh, 1986, has two son, a Bunny & a Myna, living in hell dealing with shits, loves to read book, translate them...ships everything that lives! :3

summary: Crowley, before meeting Aziraphale...such a sad scene seeing a lonely cute serpent chatting with his own tail...so God decided...
caption: Crowley, before meeting Aziraphale…such a sad scene seeing a lonely cute serpent chatting with his own tail…so God decided to make an Angel just for this lonely cute serpent, then send them both to the earth for as long as it takes to them to find that they fucking love each other!
